document.masterDocTitle: New Cixiidae from Eastern Polynesia: Oteana gen. nov. and Manurevana gen. nov. (Hemiptera: Fulgoromorpha)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New Cixiidae from Eastern Polynesia: Oteana gen. nov. and Manurevana gen. nov. (Hemiptera: Fulgoromorpha)

subSubSection.paragraph: Area of vertex, areolets, frons, and clypeus dark brown, carinae of head and fenestrae stramineous. Pronotum with discoidal and ventral areas dark brown, posterior margin and carinae stramineous. Tegulae testaceous. Mesonotum dark brown to blackish, longitudinal carinae generally lighter, more or less contrasting, posterior tip of mesonotum stramineous. Tegmina and wings hyaline, translucent, without conspicuous pattern. Costal vein dark brown, pterostigma distinct, dark brown. Venation of tegmina otherwise testaceous, slightly darker in apical third.
Proportions and carination of head and thorax as well as spinulation of hind legs as described for the genus.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 9–14.
Oteana euphranor (Fennah, 1958)
. Male genitalia. 9, genital segment, left lateral aspect; 10, same, ventral aspect; 11, anal segment, dorsal aspect; 12, same, left lateral aspect; 13, left paramere, maximal aspect; 14, aedeagus, ventral aspect; Scale bars equal 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Genital segment (figs 9, 10) bilaterally symmetrical, with both dorsal apical angles of subrectangular lobes acute; medioventral process gradually tapering posteriorly. Anal segment (figs 11, 12) symmetrical, elongately ovate. Parameres distally produced into a pointed tip (fig 13 , arrow). Aedeagus (figs 14, 15): shaft dorsally with a rounded, earshaped protrusion (fig 14 , arrow), ventrally with 3 spines: right lateral spine (a 1 ) long, slender, terete, curved laterad to the right side; median spine (a 2 ?) short, pointed, directed straight caudad; left spine (a 3 ) strong, inserting with a broad base, apically tapering, directed caudad. Left spine variable within populations (fig 15 ), unforked (in most specimens studied) or forked. Apical spine of shaft (a 5 ) long, slender, terete, curved laterobasad to the left side, almost reaching tip of flagellum. Subapical spine (a 6 ) comparatively short, slightly curved, directed left laterad. Flagellum simple, with one distinct distal spine (b 1 ).
Female genitalia as described for the genus.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 15.
Oteana euphranor (Fennah, 1958)
. Male genitalia. Variation of left lateral (ventral) spine of aedeagus shaft (a4): a–d, from population on Mt. Aorai , Tahiti Nui, e, specimen from Vaiufaufa, Tahiti Iti. Scale bar equals O.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
On native vegetation. Likely host plants are
Weinmannia parviflora
( Cunoniaceae ) (
Fennah 1958
),
Metrosideros collina
( Myrtaceae ),
Myrsine spec .
( Myrsinaceae ). From 800 –above 1600 m .
Holotype ɗ (here re­examined): Society Islands: Tahiti I., Mt. Aorai Trail, 4500–5500 ft , E.C. Zimmerman leg., BPBM ( type nr 2628 ).
Additional material: all specimens from Tahiti Island .
